fields.description: The copper plaque has writing on it. It appears to be very old but the writing, which has been carved into the copper, has not tarnished in any way.

fields.name: stone doors
fields.description: Cut into the east side of the mountain face are a massive set of stone doors on enormous iron hinges. There is strange writing carved into the stone above the doors and down each side.

fields.name: Compass of Truth
fields.description: You see a fine brass compass covered in magical runes. It is quite small and emits a very faint greenish glow. This powerful magic item can be used to navigate confusing terrain.

fields.name: dead vampire
fields.description: The Vampire gasps for his last breath and then collapses. You see the butchered corpse of the Vampire, pale and bloodless, lying here.

fields.name: Stair of Karathas
fields.description: You find a very narrow stair, chiseled into the hard rock of the mountainside, leading up. Each step is shallow and the run is uneven. Some steps are cracked or missing entirely.

fields.name: skull key
fields.description: This is a huge key, wrought of iron, whose end is capped with an intricately carved human skull.

fields.name: oak door
fields.description: To the west you see a massive oak door that is heavily reinforced with iron bands. The door is flanked on both sides by great sconces, long extinguished. A disturbing carving of the face of a horrible winged beast lies in the center of the door.

fields.name: dais
fields.description: This white marble dais is about 2 feet high and has Dwarven runes carved into the sides. In the center of the dais you notice a hidden compartment!

fields.name: hidden compartment
fields.description: This elaborately designed hidden compartment has a marble cover, that matches the dais, which opens inward on a set of cleverly-hidden hinges.

fields.name: Devil's Cauldron
fields.description: You see a small cauldron made of a red crystalline material. The base is made of pure gold. Inside, a red mist swirls about. You dare not stick your hand inside...

fields.name: green healing potion
fields.description: This magical potion can be used to heal wounds.

fields.name: blue healing potion
fields.description: This magical potion can be used to heal wounds.

fields.name: orange healing potion
fields.description: This magical potion can be used to heal wounds.

fields.name: coffin
fields.description: In the center of the room, resting atop a marble dais, is a finely polished and exquistely appointed coffin.

fields.name: red key
fields.description: You see a key made of iron that has been dyed a bright red color. The key is heavy and features many teeth. Attached to it is a small silver chain.

fields.name: portcullis
fields.description: The heavy portcullis is made of iron and operated via a mechanical counterweight system of Gnomish design.

fields.name: tower doors
fields.description: To the north lies a truly massive set of oak doors that lead into the Tower. It is protected by murder holes in the ceiling and flanked with arrow slits.

fields.name: eastern bone portcullis
fields.description: To the east you an enormous portcullis made entirely of bones, yellowed from age. This deeply unsettling barrier, which looks like a huge rib cage, prevents you from reaching the other side of the chamber.

fields.name: western bone portcullis
fields.description: To the west you an enormous portcullis made entirely of bones, yellowed from age. This deeply unsettling barrier, which looks like a huge rib cage, prevents you from reaching the other side of the chamber.

fields.name: west entry doors
fields.description: To the west you see a great set of entry doors, made of oak and heavily reinforced.

fields.name: east entry doors
fields.description: To the east you see a great set of entry doors, made of oak and heavily reinforced.

fields.name: secret door behind tapestry
fields.description: The tapestry depicts a massive battle of humans fighting against a horde of demonic creatures. A great wizard stands upon a cliff casting spells down over the battle. There is a secret door behind the tapestry!

fields.name: dead giant spider
fields.description: The creature lets out a final, piercing howl as it dies. As its poison sacs empty out, the room fills with a musty, foul stench.

fields.name: Sword of Elric
fields.description: You see an enormous two-handed sword of excellent craftsmanship and engraved with the mark of the House of Elric.

fields.name: silver dagger
fields.description: You see a beautiful dagger made of silver and covered in runes. The handle is inlaid with pearl and the hilt features a large red ruby.

fields.name: rusty sword
fields.description: This old, rusty longsword looks to be of little value and unreliable in combat.

fields.name: Darkblade
fields.description: This longsword is completely black and covered with magical runes that appear Elvish in design. The blade's hilt is wrapped in black leather.

fields.name: wooden club
fields.description: You see a huge, crudely-fashioned wooden club. The head is stained red with the blood of past victims.

fields.name: dead prisoner
fields.description: You see a corpse here, mostly bones and tattered clothing, still chained to the wall. The shackles and chains are rusted but still effective. The creature imprisoned here looked to have been human.

fields.name: leather pouch
fields.description: You find a very old brown leather pouch with a hemp drawstring to keep it fastened shut. The name 'Aragreth' is written on it in a faded red dye.

fields.name: Stone of Unbinding
fields.description: You see a small, grey stone that emits a very slight yellowish glow when touched.

fields.name: bound human
fields.description: Lying on the bed is a human body. It is dressed in a simple green tunic and pants. It is a middle-aged male, handsome and in good shape. The body is completely motionless, unbreathing, and surrounded by a pale yellow light.

fields.name: magical portcullis
fields.description: To the south is a black portcullis, fashioned from some type of rare iron-like mineral, that emits a faint reddish glow. With no keyhole or locking mechanism visible, this barrier is clearly operated only by magic.

fields.name: spell scroll
fields.description: This very old piece of brown parchment looks as if might crumble to dust if handled too much. When rolled up, it is held with a ring made of solid gold and covered in magical runes.

fields.name: red vase
fields.description: You see a large, beautiful red vase located in one of the niches. It appears that the top can be opened.

fields.name: King Raulos' body
fields.description: You see the lifeless body of King Raulos, still defiant even in death.

fields.name: Boris' body
fields.description: Boris emits a bone-chilling shriek falls to the ground, dead.

fields.name: dead Chimera
fields.description: The Chimera lets out a loud, anguished scream and then collapses.

fields.name: dead evil tree spirit
fields.description: With a loud shockwave, the Tree Spirit suddenly vaporizes into nothingness.

fields.name: Tealand's body
fields.description: Tealand lets out a scream of pain and falls. Thus passes the last living Druid of this world.

fields.name: dead Witch Seer
fields.description: The Witch Seer lets out a final cackle and falls to the ground. "So I move on to the next world..." she utters, then dies.

fields.name: dead Gargoyle
fields.description: The Gargoyle suddenly freezes and drops dead to the floor and fractures just like a stone statue.

fields.name: ale
fields.description: This malted beer smells pretty bad but has a frothy head and doesn't seem too watery.

fields.name: mead
fields.description: This  honey wine has a strong hint of spices, probably used to mask its rather low quality.

fields.name: Witch Spit
fields.description: This shot of clear liquid emits fumes power enough to cause you to break out in a fit of coughing.

fields.name: grog
fields.description: This rather potent brew seems like it is better suited to polishing shields than human consumption.

fields.name: dead Basilisk
fields.description: The Basilisk's eyes flash brightly for one last time and then the beast falls to the floor, dead.

fields.name: dead troll
fields.description: The Troll emits a huge grunt and then falls to the ground, lifeless.

fields.name: dead giant water snake
fields.description: The huge Water Snake writhes in excruciating pain for a brief moment, dangerously flailing about, then suddenly ceases all movement as it dies.

fields.name: dead grey Hellhound
fields.description: The Grey Hellhound lets out a final pleading yelp and then falls to the ground, eyes dark and lifeless.

fields.name: dead brown Hellhound
fields.description: The Brown Hellhound lets out a final pleading yelp and then falls to the ground, eyes dark and lifeless.

fields.name: dead black Hellhound
fields.description: The Black Hellhound lets out a final pleading yelp and then falls to the ground, eyes dark and lifeless.

fields.name: dead Cockatrice
fields.description: With a final, gutteral roar, the Cockatrice falls.

fields.name: dead cave troll
fields.description: The Cave Troll falls to the ground with a massive thud that shakes the ground and stirs up a thick cloud of dust. Surely every denizen of this place heard the racket!

fields.name: dead skeleton
fields.description: The Skeleton collapses with a loud clatter onto the floor. The undead life force drained, all that remains is a pile of dry old bones.

fields.name: dead green slime
fields.description: The Green Slimes dries up, no longer able to continue its biological functions, leaving behind a crusty, foul-smelling residue.

fields.name: dead Drow warrior
fields.description: The Drow Warrior clutches his chest and falls the ground with a look of hatred still burning in his dark eyes. Though dead, the eyes never close.

fields.name: dead Flameskull
fields.description: With the final blow, the Flameskull's essence fades and the skull explodes with a burst of magical fire then is never seen again.

fields.name: dead Night Hag
fields.description: The Night Hag collapses onto the ground and a thick, black oily substance begins to ooze from her wizened skin.

fields.name: dead ettin
fields.description: The Ettin falls to the ground with a giant thud, never to menace this place again.

fields.name: dead Medusa
fields.description: The Medusa creature lets out a final shriek of agony and falls to the floor, dead.

fields.name: Zorag's body
fields.description: Zorag falls to the ground, lifeless. As he draws his last breath you see a look of deep pain and frustration in his eyes before they close forever.

fields.name: dead Spectral Guardian
fields.description: With the final death blow, the Spectral Guardian collapses into a lifeless pile of dirty robes.

fields.name: jeweled leather collar
fields.description: This collar is made of finely worked leather and is set with diamonds and platinum studs.

fields.name: care package
fields.description: You see a basket here that was given to you by your friends at the Guild as a parting gift before you begin your quest.

fields.name: canteen
fields.description: This rather shabby canteen contains enough water for a short journey.

fields.name: Moleman's Jerky
fields.description: This salted and cured beef jerky will provide suitable, if somewhat chewy, nutrition. There is enough for a short journey.

fields.name: tunnel
fields.description: The grating is rusty and has become quite loose over time. You are able to remove it and thus reveal a small tunnel that leads west into the Blackwall.

fields.name: ale
fields.description: This malted beer smells pretty bad but has a frothy head and doesn't seem too watery.

fields.name: well
fields.description: A well here supplies fresh water to the city. You could fill your canteens from it.

fields.name: spring
fields.description: Just off the road is a clear mountain spring. The water looks clean enough to drink.

fields.name: trail rations
fields.description: This generous assortment of nuts, dried fruits, and dried and salted meats will provide ample nutrition.

fields.name: pool of water
fields.description: The pool is fed by a stonework depiction of a fair maiden, her face showing terrible sadness, whose eyes flow briskly with water creating the appearance of crying. The water looks clean enough to drink.

fields.text: A sign on the wall reads: TODAY'S INVENTORY:
Lantern - 9 gold pieces; Lamp Oil - 5 gold pieces; Rope - 12 gold pieces; Backpack - 15 gold pieces; Trail Rations - 4 gold pieces; Waterskin - 1 gold piece
The shopkeep says, "What adventurin' gear can I sell ya today?"
The shopkeep looks angry and booms, "You gonna buy somethin' or just run yer mouth all day?"
The shopkeep smiles and says, "Welcome! Whatever adventurin' gear you need, I got it!"
The tailor says, "Would you be interested in the coat or boots?"
The tailor says, "Welcome! I'm afraid I don't have much for you adventuring types, but I do have a nice heavy coat and a set of hiking boots that might fit you."
The tailor says, "Well, you are quite chatty today! How about we do some business?"
You have successfully tied the rope and lowered it over the cliff. You can now climb down.

King Raulos begins speaking, "Welcome, great warriors, to the Great Hall of King Raulos! As you know, we are here under dire circumstances. You have been chosen to undertake a great quest: An evil wizard named Zorag will soon unleash his wrath!

"You see, many years ago I teamed up with the wise and kindly Druids who live in The Dead Forest and we captured Zorag. We stripped him of his power and they imprisoned him in a faraway land because he was too powerful to be slain.

"Unfortunately, their magic is fading and Zorag will soon escape from his prison with all of his powers fully restored. Your quest is to discover where the Druids imprisoned him, go there, and vanquish him once and for all before his power returns.
"You must do this for King, Country and honor! Now, be on your way, noble warriors!"
Boris says, "Only I know how to get at this cache of treasure located near the Gull's Eye Cliffs! Will you join me to find it?"
Boris' faces suddenly shows a very grave look. "The treasure is guarded by a fierce beast. Will you help me slay it? We'll divide the spoils evenly!" he says.
Boris says, "The journey to the Cliffs will be easier with you present! Will you join me so we can retire rich?"
Boris' eyes light up. "Wonderful! Then let us get out of this dump and go due east to the Gull's Eye Cliffs! I'll lead the way!" he exclaims.
Boris says, "Yes, the treasure is hidden in a cave near the Gull's Eye Cliffs. Only I know how to find it! Will you help me?"
Boris says, "There is great treasure near the Gull's Eye Cliffs. Only I know how to find it! Will you help me?"

Boris looks up from his drink and gets a gleam in his eye. "Now you look like a strong and trustworthy warrior! I need someone to join me in an adventure to procure a huge cache of guarded treasure. Interested? We'll share the treasure fairly."
Boris says, "The treasure is in a magical cave, near the Cliffs, with a hidden tunnel that only I can unlock! Will you help me?"
Boris beckons you to follow him. "Let us proceed east along this road," he says.
Boris motions for you to follow him. "Let us proceed south," he says.
Boris begins to get excited. "We're outside of the city! Let us proceed east to riches!" he exclaims.
Boris points south and says, "There is the cave! We are almost there!"

Boris concentrates carefully on the iron door to the south and then utters some magic words that you cannot hear. Suddenly, the iron door unlocks and the glowing ceases. "We're almost there!" Boris exclaims.
Boris says, "Well done! I'll just take my share and be on my way!". With that, he grabs his fair portion of the treasure and runs out of the cave.
Boris nervously stamps his feet and exclaims, "So close! The treasure lies just ahead!"
Your attack blows through the Evil Tree Spirit as if nothing were there! The apparition is unaffected.
Your Blast spell causes the Evil Tree Spirit's translucent form to waver temporarily but otherwise has no effect.
A beam of pure white light shoots from the wand and hits the Evil Tree Spirit. You hear an unsettling shriek and then the spirit disappears!
A beam of pure white light shoots from the wand but nothing happens.

Suddlenly, a large group of knights carrying King Raulos' banner appears. The leader speaks, "You were warned to proceed directly to the Great Hall in order to do your service to the king! You did not. Failure to heed summons is treason!"
With that, the knights hang you from the nearest tree with a sign around your neck that reads, "Hanged for Abandonment of Duty, by Order of the King".
The sign reads, "The Dead Forest. Stray not from the path!"
Tealand says, "King Raulos asked the Druids to help him imprison an evil wizard. Though the historical scrolls of this period are incomplete, I understand that we did so."
Tealand's face grows dim and he says in a soft voice, "Our order was slaughtered by evil golems many years ago. I'm afraid that now our greatness fades away as only I remain."
Tealand suddenly gets an angry air about him. "We don't know who summoned those evil constructs, but they nearly wiped out the Order!" he says.
Tealand responds, "Zorag was an evil wizard that my Order imprisoned long ago. He was a deceptive and false man... nevertheless we were victorious in his capture."

Tealand thinks for a moment and says, "Our historical scrolls record that the Druids imprisoned an evil wizard, Zorag, there many years ago. Unfortunately, I do not know where the caverns are - I have never left this forest."

Tealand strokes his short beard for a moment then says, "Unfortunately, our scrolls do not record precisely where Zorag was imprisoned. It seems most likely that it was in Fellspawn Caverns but I cannot be certain."
Tealand gives you a kind look and says, "Welcome, weary travelers, to the dominion of the Druids. How can I help you?"
The writing on the copper plaque says, "Speak the name of the Druid you seek and he shall be summoned".
The blue orb suddenly flashes a brilliant blue light for only a brief moment. Almost as quickly as the flash subsides, a robed man strolls out of the forest with his hands clasped together in front.
Tealand smiles warmly and says, "I will aid you on your quest." He then follows you out of the clearing.
You are finding the cold of the mountains to be quite intolerable.
It is almost unbearably cold here. You feel as if you go any further you might freeze to death!
You have succumbed to the bitter cold of the mountains! Next time bring a coat...
Tealand studies the writing on the stone doors then says, "I recognize this writing! It is the language of the Dwarves. I believe I can open them."

He then begins to utter arcane words in an unknown language. As soon as he finishes, the stone doors slowly open with a deep grinding sound. As they open, the cavern behind belches out a cloud of dust. "We may now enter!" he exclaims.
After you search the Vampire's corpse, you find a magical compass!

You've strayed off the path! You fall into the marshes and immediately feel the sting of the foul waters as it burns your skin. A mysterious force begins to pull you further down into the mucky depths! You struggle to escape...
Fortunately, you are able to climb out before you drown! Watch your step next time!
As you sink deeper you realize your life is over and you will rot in the Foulwater Marshes for all eternity... Next time, watch your footing!
As you approach, a gruff voice calls out from one of the towers, "Begone Guild scum! Your kind aren't welcome in this city!" With that, the gate is quickly drawn shut.
The old woman lets out a shrill cackle. "Welcome, brave ones!" she says.

"I see your minds and I know your souls. I have knowledge that spans the ages and I can aid your quest. But first, I seek the Devil's Cauldron, an ancient artifact. It lies beyond the locked door at the other end of the Bridge of Lahreth."
She reaches into her robes and withdraws a huge iron key, whose end is capped with an intricately carved human skull, and gives it to you.
She continues in a grave voice, "But, beware for it is well-guarded! I cannot pass beyond that door, but you can. Bring me the Cauldron and I shall enlighten you all!"
The old witch cackles with glee. "Yes! You have succeeded. I am true to my word. Ask what you may..." she says.
A large stone archway leads south. To the west is a set of large doors leading out.
As you open the coffin the lid makes an ominous creak. Suddenly, a thick mist flows out of the coffin and takes the shape of a man!
As you examine the dead spider, you find a red key hanging from one of the spider's legs via a small silver chain.
It is a bright and clear sunny day. The sound of birds and wilderness animals are all about.
It is a slightly overcast day but there is enough sun to keep the day fairly warm.
A light rain makes this overcast day even drearier.
A heavy, driving rain soaks you to the bone. Ominous clouds block the sun and make the day grey and foreboding.
It is bitterly cold here and the sun is completely obscured by heavy clouds.
There is a thick, driving snow that makes travel difficult. It is very cold and wet.
Heavy snow pours from the dark and cloudy sky above. The cold penetrates straight into your bones.
High winds and thick, wet snow makes travel very slow. Heavy, grey clouds block out the sun making the day dreary and grim. There is no relief from the persistent cold.
It is very cloudy and overcast. The sun is nowhere to be seen.
A light rain makes travel through the swamp even more unpleasant. Heavy, dark clouds overhead completely block out the sun.
A heavy rain soaks you to the core and makes the narrow paths of this place even more difficult to traverse. The day is dark, grim and overcast.
Heavy clouds hang overhead. The air is completely still and very damp. The sun has no chance of shedding its light in this grim place.
The Witch Seer's face takes on a grim look. "King Raulos? A smart and dangerous man. He seeks power and wealth above all else. Beware of his intentions!"

She gently picks at a mole on her nose as she contemplates her response. "Zorag was a great wizard," she explains, "but his power was not as great as he thought. His attempts to save the world seem to have backfired. Now he rots in a dark prison."
"That is a sad story," she says. "The Druids attempted to stop King Raulos' quest for power but were ultimately thwarted by deadly golems."
"The golems were summoned by King Raulos so that he could stop Zorag and the Druids from overthrowing him!" she says. "They killed off the Druids before Raulos could learn where they imprisoned him!"
The Witch Seer cackles and says, "Zorag lies imprisoned at the top of Grimhold's Tower. You have not the strength to free him for that place is infested with evil!"
"It is a black tower once occupied by a great artificer. Now it is a fell and evil place," she says, "that lies beyond the Foulwater Marshes."
She takes on a grim look and says, "The Foulwater Marshes are deadly. Enter them without magic to guide you and you will surely be lost!"
"I have sought a magical artifact, known as the Devil's Cauldron, for ages. It is why I am here in this wretched dungeon!" she says, annoyed.
"The cauldron is guarded by a conjured abomination of great power. Be careful!" she says and then cackles.
She smiles and says, "Zorag was a hero but his arrogance got the best of him. He tried to spare the world the evils of Raulos but ultimately failed."
The old Witch Seer gets visibly impatient. "I'll give you the knowledge you seek when you bring me the Devil's Cauldron!" she says and waves you off.
King Raulos looks at you coldly. "Why are you here?" he booms. "Resume your quest and sully not my Great Hall with your dirty boots!"

Elric, Sandeer and Sorsha approach you. Sandeer says, "We have decided to allow you, the most experienced, to lead our party. We shall be known as the 'Last Fellowship' since the world will fall into ruin if we fail. Now, let us be on our way!"
King Raulos welcomes you back with a thunderous applause. "Congratulations on the success of your quest! I knew I could count on you!" He pauses for a long moment and then lets out a deep laugh.

"I can always leave it to a mindless twit from the Guild of Free Adventurers to do my bidding. How does it feel to be my puppet? Now that Zorag, that noble fool, is dead I will conquer this land and all shall bow to my greatness!"
With that, he raises his great sword and a bright flash of light fills the room. You feel your soul being drained from your body until there is nothing but cold darkness...
Zorag raises his staff and exclaims, "King Raulos, prepare to meet your doom! Long have you sat in that throne plotting to take over the world but now you shall pay for your wickedness!"
Sandeer says, "At last! This evil menace has been vanquished. The world is free!"

Zorag says, "Thus ends our great Fellowship. You are all truly great warriors!" He looks sad for a moment, then his eyes brighten and he holds his head high, "We shall elect a new King and this land shall prosper under the banner of hope and freedom!"

Then, Zorag looks at you and says, "Thank you for freeing me. You are a truly great adventurer and the pride of the Kingdom! Now, return home to your friends and family and tell them of your great deeds!"
The others slowly take their turns saying goodbye to you and to each other and proceed to leave the Great Hall, heads bowed low and pride showing on their faces...
Zorag quickly turns to you and says urgently, "Attack not King Raulos with weapons! You cannot injure him! Focus on his minions!"
King Raulos' armour flashes a bright red light that fills the room and the attack is immediately repulsed!
King Raulos' sword flashes a brilliant white and easily parries the blow!
King Raulos speaks a magical word and blinks out of existence for a brief moment - the attack meets nothing but air!
Zorag quickly casts a healing spell on himself.

Elric looks you up and down and flashes a fake smile from under his upturned nose. "Hello," he mutters with a degree of condescension. "I am the Prince of the Duchy of Elebron and you'd do well to speak with your own kind."

Sandeer pulls the hood from around his head and gives you a warm handshake. "It is a pleasure to join you on this epic quest!" he says brightly. "I'm a wizard from the Southlands and I am the last of my kind..." he trails off and stares vacantly away.

Sorsha flashes you a mischievous smile. "We shall see if you have what it takes to survive this adventure! I'm a Sword-Maiden from the Realm of Perrenor. Those who dance with me rarely live to tell about it!" she says with pride.
King Raulos utters a magical word, there is a bright flash of red light, and suddenly a fierce Iron Golem appears out of thin air to join the battle!
King Raulos utters a magical word, there is a bright flash of blue light, and suddenly a terrible Stone Golem appears out of thin air! This unnatural summoned being joins the battle!
King Raulos utters a magical word, there is a bright flash of green light, and suddenly a terrible Clay Golem appears out of thin air! This evil conjuration joins the battle!

King Raulos emits a deep, wicked laugh. "Fools, prepare to meet your doom!" he bellows. With that, he utters a few magical words and immediately conjures 3 unnatural constructs - Golems! One made of stone, one of iron, and one of clay.
As you examine the corpse, you find a leather pouch hidden among the tattered clothing!
You will need powerful magic in order to free this body from the necromancy that binds it.
Sandeer looks at the body and says, "This person has been bound with powerful necromancy. He is trapped in the spirit world and only powerful magic beyond my skill can free him."

As you approach the bound human, the Spectral Guardian lets out an ear-piercing shriek that immediately drops you to your knees! As long as the Spectral Guardian is here, you will not be able to free this bound soul.
Using the Stone of Unbinding, you are able to break the necromancy that binds this captured soul. As the pale light fades, the person slowly wakes from his magical slumber.

He looks at you and says, "Thank you for unbinding me. I've been stuck in the sprit world for far too long... My name is Zorag. Please, you must take me to King Raulos right away. He imprisoned me and I intend to avenge myself upon him!"
The scroll is written in a strange, heiroglyphic language that you cannot understand. Only a powerful wizard would be able to read it and thus harness the power of the scroll.

Sandeer takes the scroll, unrolls it, and studies the writing. After a moment's thought, he says, "This powerful scroll is used to unlock magical gates and barriers. Perhaps this will be of use to us later."

Sandeer suddenly interjects, "Perhaps the scroll we found earlier will open this magical portcullis!" He then removes the scroll from his robes and begins to read the scroll aloud in a curious tongue unfamiliar to you.
As soon as he finishes, the magical glow of the portcullis flickers a brief moment and then it opens!
While examining the fractured remains of the once-animated Gargoyle, you find a jeweled leather collar!

The barkeep flashes a wide, bright grin. "What's yer poison?" he asks while scrubbing glassware with a rather filthy cloth. "We got ale and mead. The house specialty is 'Witch Spit'. Oh! I just got in a fresh shipment 'o grog." he says.

You are greeted warmly by the barkeep. "Welcome, welcome! We don't get many adventurers in here! We got some odd folk and the occasional looney who thinks he's a Druid but never an honest warrior whose seen real battle!" he beams.
The bar wench greets you as you enter. She doesn't bother to look up and coldly says, "We only serve ale. Buy a mug or get out."
The bar wench rolls her eyes. "Buy a mug of ale or be on yer way!" she barks.
The barkeep takes on a patronizing, falsely serious demeanor and says, "You know how it is around here. Strange folk all about. Maybe you buy a drink and I'll have a bit more to say."

The barkeep leans over the well-worn oak bar and darts his eyes about the room before he speaks in a low whisper. "We get a lot of hobbits and wanderers, a few dwarves, and the occasional orc half-breed. Strange lot, always want to bend your ear."

"But the strangest is an odd fellow indeed and he sure likes his mead. He claims to be a Druid! Such nonsense! Everyone knows there ain't no more Druids alive in these lands. Calls himself 'Tealand', he does..." and the barkeep trails off in thought...
The barkeep gets angry and says, "I done told ye all I have to say. Buy another drink if you want me to repeat meself!"
The bar wench lets out a small laugh and says, "Oh, he's harmless. Comes in here all the time talkin' big plans. He's a dreamer and definitely not an adventurer."
The Stone of Unbinding does not seem to work.
Sandeer strokes his chin a moment then says, "You must use your Power spell to activate the magic in your ancient Stone of Unbinding. I hope Tokas taught you well!"
When you cast your spell, the Stone of Unbinding begins to glow a bright yellow color! You can feel powerful, arcane energy radiating from within.
Zorag says, "King Raulos is an evil man. He speaks only lies. I tried to save the kingdom from his tyranny. I will not fail this time!"
Zorag says, "The Druids were slaughtered by King Raulos when they tried to help me."
Zorag exclaims, "Thank you for freeing me. Now, we must confront King Raulos and stop his diabolical plans!"
HINT: When you meet characters in the adventure, be sure to "SAY HELLO TO <monster>". You never know who might have useful information!
You find yourself hopelessly lost in the Marshes. You try your best to find your way, but you just end up backtracking.
This deep in the marsh, you find yourself starting to get lost, until the Compass of Truth guides you down a safe, dry path.
King Raulos collapses to the ground as he curses you for ruining his plans. "Though my body breaks, my spirit endures! I'll be back!" he says with his last breath.
With Raulos dead, your party quickly dispatches the remaining golems.
You begin your journey out of the land of Behlos and back to the Main Hall.

fields.name: shopkeep
fields.description: Behind the counter stands a large man with red hair. He is wearing rugged clothing as if he plans to go on an adventure at any moment.

fields.name: tailor
fields.description: Standing here is a skinny but sharply dressed man wearing a bright blue fedora. He has a pencil wedged behind his ear and is wearing very expensive and gaudy jewelry.

fields.name: King Raulos
fields.description: You see King Raulos, an imposing figure garbed in exquisite purple robes that hide armor underneath. His long, stately grey beard and fierce eyes adorn a wizened face. Though he is old, he is still a man in full command of his kingdom.

fields.name: Boris
fields.description: You see a short, dumpy man wearing a grey cloak with a hood that partially covers his face. He wears the simple clothes of a common laborer. His largely toothless smile does not inspire confidence.

fields.name: Chimera
fields.description: You see a huge beast with 2 heads! One is that of a lion, the other a goat. The serpentine tail of this monster ends in vicious serpent's head.

fields.name: evil tree spirit
fields.description: You see a translucent ghost-like figure before you. It is shaped somewhat like a tree, except that on the trunk is a twisted and evil face with glowing green eyes. This dark apparition, a pervision of an oak tree, arouses great fear in you.

fields.name: Tealand
fields.description: You see a tall man with a short, white beard. He is quite young, and wears heavily layered green robes that complement his green eyes. He is barefoot and there are strange runes tattooed on his feet.
fields.combat_verbs: conjures fire at, casts entanglement spell at, conjures flaming arrows at

fields.name: vampire
fields.description: You see a very tall man with a pale face wearing an expensive-looking black suit. His hair is slicked back and lathered with oil. The sharp, pointy teeth that adorn his lusty grin indicate this is no friend!

fields.name: Witch Seer
fields.description: You see an old and wizened woman covered in layers of old robes. Her hair is wild and tangled and there are no pupils in her milky white eyes. A hooked nose shelters a narrow, snarled mouth devoid of teeth.
fields.combat_verbs: conjures fire at, casts Magic Missile spell at, conjures lightning at

fields.name: gargoyle
fields.description: You see a grotesque, winged humanoid creature. It has a great horn on its forehead and each of its four arms are tipped with sharp claws. Its gray hide is made of a hard material that resembles rock. There is a studded leather collar around its neck.

fields.name: Sorsha
fields.description: You see a beautiful woman dressed in black combat leather that hugs every curve of her body. This tall, raven-haired beauty has dark, piercing eyes and flawless milky white skin. She introduces herself as Sorsha.

fields.name: Elric
fields.description: You see a giant of a man outfitted in heavy chain mail armour. His up-turned nose and formal demeanor hint at a noble upbringing. At his side hangs a huge two-handed sword, and a purple cape drapes from his shoulders. He introduces himself as Elric of House Elric.

fields.name: Sandeer
fields.description: You see a very old man in red robes carrying a wooden staff. He has a long beard and dark skin. Though his eyes are kindly, a sense of great power eminates from within. He says his name is Sandeer.
fields.combat_verbs: conjures fire at, casts Magic Missile spell at, conjures lightning at

fields.name: orc
fields.description: A vicious orc raiding party appears in the night and attacks your camp!

fields.name: goblin
fields.description: A sneaky goblin raiding party appears in the night and attacks your camp!

fields.name: hobgoblin
fields.description: A horde of mischevious hobgoblins appears in the night and attacks your camp!

fields.name: gnoll
fields.description: A group of filthy, vicious gnolls appears in the night and attacks your camp!

fields.name: giant spider
fields.description: You see an enormous black spider with a red underside. Its eyes glow with a pale green light and its hairy black legs scurry about with remarkable speed. A dagger-like stinger can be seen at the end of a long, curved tail.

fields.name: Basilisk
fields.description: You see a large, serpent-like creature here. Six clawed legs spring from its thick, scale-covered body. The eyes are narrow, sharp, and glow a pale green color.

fields.name: troll
fields.description: An enormous, and rather smelly, troll blocks your path. The tall creature, completely covered in thick black fur, has long ape-like arms and sharp teeth. The creature growls, in a crude form of the Common tongue, "None shall pass!"

fields.name: giant water snake
fields.description: You see a huge green snake accented with bright orange stripes. It has enormous fangs and eyes that are completely black. This unnatural beast's mouth looks like it could engulf a large man in a single bite. The tail ends in a fierce stinger.

fields.name: grey Hellhound
fields.description: You see a large wolf-like creature with red eyes. It snarls and growls at your presence. This beast is as tall as you and covered in grey fur.

fields.name: brown Hellhound
fields.description: You see a large wolf-like creature with red eyes. This beast is covered in brown fur with black patches. It paws the ground in anticipation of battle.

fields.name: black Hellhound
fields.description: You see a large wolf-like creature with red eyes. This beast is covered in mangy black fur. Slobber oozes from its enormous jowls in preparation for its next meal.

fields.name: Cockatrice
fields.description: You see a huge winged creature with the body of a dragon, the scaly tail of a crocodile, and a head like a rooster. It emits an enormous roar that shakes the very ground!

fields.name: cave troll
fields.description: You see a huge cave troll here. Standing over 10 feet tall, this formidable opponent shakes the very ground as it moves. The thick hide of this beast is sparsely covered in fur and its pinpoint eyes reveal a dim intellect.

fields.name: skeleton
fields.description: You see a tall animated skeleton here. The yellowed bones are dry and cracked and this unnatural abomination makes a clacking sound as it lumbers toward you.

fields.name: green slime
fields.description: You see a large amorphous blob of green ooze. It senses your presence and quickly moves by extending pseudopods. The acidic, acrid smell eminating from this creature instantly makes you nauseous.
fields.combat_verbs: launches a pseudopod at, squirts acid at, blasts acid at

fields.name: Drow warrior
fields.description: You see a tall male warrior wearing black leather armor and wielding a black longsword. His hair is pure white and the milky eyes have no pupils. He appears to be a dark perversion of the Elvish race.

fields.name: Flameskull
fields.description: Floating before you is a large, disembodied humanoid skull wreathed in flames. There are red pinpoints of light deep in the eyesockets and the jaw repeatedly opens and snaps shut with ferocity.
fields.combat_verbs: shoots lightning at, breathes fire at, bites

fields.name: Night Hag
fields.description: You see an old, ugly woman in scraggly clothes and adorned with numerous jewels and tattoos. Her wide eyes focus on you intently. She is very tall and her broad hands end in vicious talons. Razor sharp teeth hide behind her snarling black lips.

fields.name: ettin
fields.description: You see a giant humanoid figure with two heads. Each head has pig-like qualities and a wide mouth from which tusks protrude. A hide-like armour, still covered in fur, covers its torso but leaves its enormous arms exposed; the right one wields a wood club.

fields.name: Medusa
fields.description: You see a fantastically hideous woman wearing leather armor and covered in gaudy jewelry. Her eyes glow green and where her hair should be is a nest of hissing snakes! Her twisted smile reveals a set of spiked teeth behind which resides a forked tongue.

fields.name: Zorag
fields.description: You see a handsome, middle-aged man wearing a simple green tunic. He has bright eyes and his white hair is combed and pulled back into a long ponytail. A jet-black goatee and a giant silver hoop in his nose distinguish an otherwise plain face.
fields.combat_verbs: casts Meteor Swarm spell at, casts Blast spell at, conjures lightning at

fields.name: Iron Golem
fields.description: You see a huge, giant-like creature made entirely of iron. Its eyes glow bright red and the ground shakes when it moves!

fields.name: Stone Golem
fields.description: You see a huge, giant-like creature made entirely of stone. Its eyes glow bright red and the ground shakes when it moves!

fields.name: Clay Golem
fields.description: You see a huge, giant-like creature made entirely of clay. Its eyes glow bright red and the ground shakes when it moves!

fields.name: Spectral Guardian
fields.description: You see a tall, skinny, human-like figure shrouded in pitch-black robes. The figure is unmoving but you sense it watches you. Underneath the hood and in the sleeves of the robes you see nothing but air. There are no legs - the robes seem to float mid-air!
fields.combat_verbs: blasts, breathes magical fire at, breathes magical cold at

fields.name: barkeep
fields.description: Behind the bar stands a freakishly tall and lanky man. He is wearing an apron, white shirt and a black bowtie all of which clearly haven't been washed in years. He serves the thirsty patrons with speed and finesse.

fields.name: bar wench
fields.description: Behind the bar stands a rather plump an unattractive woman wearing practically nothing. She has black hair and piercing green eyes and the scowl on her face would indicate she doesn't like to be hassled.

fields.question: The lantern keeps running out of fuel!
How do I open the doors in the cave?
How do I get past the evil tree spirit?
How do I use the Orb?
How do I get into the caverns?
What do I do at the chasm?
I keep getting lost in the swamp!
Where do I find some keys and other items?
How do I get into the locked cell?
Where is Zorag, and what do I do with him?

fields.answer: You can TALK to many NPCs in this adventure. Sometimes they have general advice to say (TALK TO BARKEEP) and other times you need to know a specific keyword (TALK TO BARKEEP ABOUT RAULOS).
Some NPCs will only give you information if you do something for them first. For example, the bartenders will be more forthcoming if you buy a drink before asking questions.

Merchants in Behlos City sell several items that you will need for your quest. You can buy these with the BUY command For example, in the Burly Irishman's outfitter shop, you could BUY LANTERN or BUY WATERSKIN.
You can buy some items, like rations and lamp oil, multiple times. Each time you buy these, it will increase the amount you're carrying. The items will never disappear from the shop inventory.

You will travel far in this adventure, and you will need to eat, drink, and sleep. Your character will automatically consume food and water when you are hungry or thirsty, as long as you have any. To make camp for the night, just use the "CAMP" command, but beware that you might be attacked by wandering monsters while you sleep.

Make sure to keep your canteens and water skins full, in case you travel far from the city where provisions are scarce. There are a few different places to refill your water containers. For example, go to the city square in Behlos City, where there is a well, and use the command "FILL CANTEEN" or "FILL WATERSKIN".

You can buy more lamp oil from the outfitter shop. Keep a lot of it around in case you travel into a large dungeon. When the lantern runs low, you can refill it using the "FILL LANTERN" command, if you have any oil.
You need to bring a special NPC along to help open the doors.
Talk to Boris in the Trollsfire Pub (NE part of Behlos City). He's looking for someone to join him on a treasure hunt.

Go to the Trollsfire Pub (from the town square, go east 2, north 2, west, and north). TALK TO BORIS, then TALK TO BORIS ABOUT TREASURE. He'll join you and give you directions to the treasure. He can open the door in the cave.
Fighting it won't work. You need a special item.
Get the Wand of Warding from Boris' treasure cave. USE WAND and point it at the spirit to destroy it.
Read the plaque on the pedestal. It tells you to say the name of the person to summon. If you don't know the right name, try asking around Behlos City.
The barkeep in the Black Horse Tavern knows a lot about various people who are important to your quest. (South, then east, then north from the town square.)
Go to the Black Horse Tavern. Buy a drink. TALK TO BARKEEP ABOUT DRUIDS.
In the clearing with the Orb, SAY TEALAND and the Druid named Tealand will appear.
Go to the mountain pass. Examine the stonework to find a stairway. Make sure you have a warm coat (you can purchase one in Behlos City.) The door at the top is magically locked, but an NPC can help.
Use the Orb to summon Tealand. Bring him with you to the mountaintop and he can open the door.
Something you can buy in Behlos City is necessary here.
From the west end of the ledge, you can USE ROPE (if you have it) to climb down to the bridge in the chasm.
The swamp is an easy place to get lost. You need a special item to navigate through it.
The item you need is the Compass of Truth. The vampire in the Fellspawn Caverns has it. Kill him, then EXAMINE DEAD VAMPIRE to find it.
You can search dead bodies with the EXAMINE command. Sometimes this reveals interesting items.
One key can be found by searching the dead giant spider in the caverns.
There is a magic scroll somewhere in the tower. (Try looking inside other items you find.) But you won't be able to use it yourself. You'll need NPC help.
Give the scroll to Sandeer the wizard. He can read it, and he'll use the spell on it when you need it.
Look on the top level of the tower. Try inspecting things on the walls.
Once you find him, you need to dispose of the Spectral Guardian and wake him using the Stone of Unbinding.
The Spectral Guardian can be attacked like a normal monster (unlike, say, the evil tree spirit.)
Look for a red vase in the west side of Level 1 of the Tower. Inside it is a scroll which will open a prison cell. The Stone of Unbinding is inside. (EXAMINE DEAD PRISONER).
Once you have the Stone, you need to use the POWER spell to activate it. You can then FREE BOUND HUMAN.

Go directly to Behlos City and talk to King Raulos. He'll give you your quest and some companions. Go to the shops and buy a lantern, lamp oil, rations, a waterskin, a rope, and a winter coat. Go to the Black Horse Tavern and talk to the barkeep about druids. Go to the Trollsfire Pub and talk to Boris. Join him and fight the Chimera in the cave to the east of the city. Get the Wand of Warding.

Travel through the mountains to the forest. Summon Tealand using the Orb. Go to the Fellspawn Caverns (near the mountain peak) and fight the vampire. Search his body for the Compass of Truth. Fight the Giant Spider and search its body for a key. Travel south to the ledge and use the rope to climb down. Go east and talk to the Witch Seer. Go west across the bridge and fight the gargoyle. Get the couldron and return to the witch, who tells you what's really going on and who's been lying to you.

Go through the swamp to the Tower and enter through the sewers. Find the scroll in the Red Vase on level 1. Use it to open the cell door on level 2. Search the corpse for the Stone of Unbinding. Go up to level 4 and proceed to the far south end. Search the tapestry to find a secret door.
Kill the Spectral Guardian and use the Stone of Unbinding to awaken Zorag. If you allow him to join you, return to King Raulos and prepare for a fight.
